divide.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /****************************************************************************/
00011 unsigned int uDivide(unsigned int dividend,unsigned int divisor)
00012 {
00013     unsigned int numBits = 16;      /* Defines the word length */
00014     unsigned int t, q, bit, d;
00015     int i;
00016     unsigned int remainder = 0;
00017     unsigned int quotient = 0;
00018 /* Special cases: divide by zero, or zero result, return zero. */
00019     if ((divisor == 0) || (divisor > dividend)) return 0;
00020     if (divisor == dividend) return 1;
00021 /* Shift the upper bits of the dividend into the remainder until the
00022 remainder > divisor. */
00023     while (remainder < divisor)
00024     {
00025         bit = (dividend >> (numBits-1)) & 0x01);    /* Extract the MSB */
00026         remainder = ((remainder << 1) | bit);       /* Shift into the remainder */
00027         d = dividend;
00028         dividend = (dividend << 1);
00029         numBits--;
00030     }
00031 /* Step back one to avoid a complicated test in the above loop. */
00032     dividend = d;
00033     remainder = (remainder >> 1);
00034     numBits++;
00035 /* This leaves the dividend normalised ready to generate a result. */
00036     for (i = 0; i < numBits; i++)
00037     {
00038         bit = (dividend >> (numBits-1)) & 0x01);    /* Extract the MSB */
00039         remainder = ((remainder << 1) | bit);       /* Shift into the remainder */
00040         t = remainder - divisor;
00041         q = !((t >> (numBits-1)) & 0x01);           /* Extract the MSB and invert */
00042         dividend = (dividend << 1);
00043         quotient = ((quotient << 1) | q);           /* shift into quotient */
00044         if (q) remainder = t;
00045     }
00046     return quotient;
00047 }
